io.seanbailey.adapter

Class SQLChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.seanbailey.adapter.SQLChain

  • public class SQLChain
extends java.lang.Object
    A chain of SQL operations, that come together to create a single SQL Query when executed.
    Since:
    2018-05-14

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SQLChain.Finisher
      An enum containing all possible finisher operations.

      • where

        public SQLChain where(java.lang.String condition,
                      java.lang.Object object)
        Adds a condition that must be met by all returned models.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that must be met.
        object - Object to insert into condition at question mark.
        Returns:
        An SQLChain for further chaining.

      • offset

        public SQLChain offset(int offset)
        Offsets the results by the given number of rows. You would usually want to use this in conjunction with limit.
        Parameters:
        offset - Number of rows to offset results by.
        Returns:
        An SQLChain for further chaining.
        Since:
        2018-05-14

      • page

        public SQLChain page(int page)
        Sets which page the result set should be returned from.
        Parameters:
        page - The page to return.
        Returns:
        An SQLChain for further chaining.

      • order

        public SQLChain order(java.lang.String attribute)
        Applies a new order. You may chain more than one, and they will be applied in the order that they are chained.
        Parameters:
        attribute - Attribute to order by.
        Returns:
        An SQLChain for further chaining.
        Since:
        2018-05-14

      • order

        public SQLChain order(java.lang.String attribute,
                      Order order)
        Applies a new order. You may chain more than one, and they will be applied in the order that they are chained.
        Parameters:
        attribute - Attribute to order by.
        order - Direction to order by.
        Returns:
        An SQLChain for further chaining.
        Since:
        2018-05-14

      • count

        public int count()
          throws java.sql.SQLException,
                 SQLAdapterException
        Returns the total number of models that match the chain.
        Returns:
        The number of models.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the generated SQL is malformed, or some other SQL related exception is encountered.
        SQLAdapterException - if the generated SQL cannot be mapped to Java for some reason.
        Since:
        2018-05-14

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                      SQLAdapterException
        Determines whether a given model exists.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether or not a model matching the conditions outlined by the SQL chain was found.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the generated SQL is malformed, or some other SQL related exception is encountered.
        SQLAdapterException - if the generated SQL cannot be mapped to Java for some reason.
        Since:
        2018-05-14

      • execute

        public java.util.List<Model> execute()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                     SQLAdapterException
        Finishes a chain, and returns the results.
        Returns:
        An array of models that match the conditions outlined by the SQL chain.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the generated SQL is malformed or some other error occurs.
        SQLAdapterException - if the resultant SQL cannot be mapped to Java models.
        Since:
        2018-05-14
